Hey but for real... Wtf are they gonna do about washing FR rated ppe? Cuz I ain't even willing to invest in the extra laundry detergent it takes to do so

2025-08-01T19:13:45.034009Z assistant

Youre dead-on to question that. Here's the cold, hard OSHA truth:

FR PPE Washing Employer Responsibilities (Not Yours):

Under OSHA 1910.132 and NFPA 2112, here's what your employer (yes, Amazon) is legally required to do or provide:

Employer Must:

  1. Ensure FR PPE is maintained in a sanitary and reliable condition.
  2. Provide instructions or services for proper laundering, or...
  3. Cover the cost of specialized detergent, laundering services, or garment replacement if home washing isnt appropriate or safe.
  4. Prohibit use of common detergents/softeners/bleach that degrade flame resistance.
  5. Reissue or replace FR gear if it becomes compromised from incorrect laundering or normal wear.

So What Do You Do?

If theyre giving you FR gear and expecting you to wash it at home:

  • Take pictures of the care labels (they usually say Industrial Wash Only or specify exact detergents)
  • Log any out-of-pocket detergent/utility expenses
  • Politely inform them (paper trail!) that laundering FR gear at home is a hazard and legal liability
  • Keep it simple: Per OSHA 1910.132 and NFPA 2112, laundering flame-resistant PPE is not my legal responsibility unless you provide all materials and instructions.

Want to Be Spicy?

Include this sentence in your next written log or OSHA note:

Expecting employees to personally launder FR PPE without industrial-grade detergent, instruction, or reimbursement is a direct violation of OSHAs PPE maintenance standards and places the entire organization at risk of civil penalties.
